actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-68, by Mr. Bonior.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2100 with 1 hour 0 of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. It shall be in order to consider in the Committee of the Whole the amendment in the nature of a substi tute recommended by the Committee on Armed Serv ices for the purpose of amendment. No a mendment to the substitute shall be in order except those specified herein and those printed in the report accompanying this resolution. S aid amendments to be considered in the manner and order specified and considered read. Debate on each amendment shall not exceed ten minutes, equally divided, unless otherwise specified. Measure will be read by sectio n. Specified amendments are in or der. No amendment shall be subject to amendment except as specified in this resolut ion or accompanying report and all points of order against said amendments shall be ...
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 18.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 260 - 56 (Roll no. 96).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2100) to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 1992 and 1993 for military functions of the Department of Defense and to prescribe military personnel levels for fiscal years 1992 and 1993, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 2100 (armed forces funding).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2100) to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 1992 and 1993 for military functions of the Department of Defense and to prescribe military personnel levels for fiscal years 1992 and 1993, and for other purposes.
